responses.text: Anything I can do for you?

dynamic_line: This is a school that we've made into a sort of a safehouse from this whole... disaster.

responses.text: So are you with the school or something?

dynamic_line: Yeah. There is School hall monitor somewhere around here if you have any questions relating to what the school, or at least the ones who is left, is up to.

responses.text: Oh, okay.  I'll go look for him then!

dynamic_line: Anything valuable really.  If you really want to know, go ask one of the actual traders.  I'm just protecting other survivors.

responses.text: I'll go talk to them later.

dynamic_line: Will not be easy, but possible.
Sorry, pal. Some things cannot be done.

responses.text: So no negotiating?  No, 'If you do this quest then we'll let you in?'

dynamic_line: Hmm... There should be a way for that.

responses.text: Nah, I ain't gonna do that.

dynamic_line: Depends on what you want.  Go talk to a so-called merchant if you have anything to sell.  Otherwise the School hall monitor might have something, if you can find him.  But if you're just looking for someone to put a good word in, I might have something for you.

responses.text: A good word might be helpful.  What do you need?
School hall monitor huh, I'll go talk to him!
Who are the School hall monitor?

dynamic_line: They are the police type of guys for school. Well, they were, before the whole world ended.

responses.text: Okay, I'll go look for him then. Thanks!

dynamic_line: Stay safe out there.  Hate to have to kill you after you've already died.

description: Make a friend at the school by handing over around eight cans of cola and get cola bombs.

dialogue.describe: Come on man, I just need a pack of cola to use as bombs.
dialogue.offer: With all that's been going on, it's been more and more difficult to find some cola.  My stash has been running low for a while now.  Think you could help me out here?  A few cans are all I need.
dialogue.accepted: Thanks, it's great to see someone willing to help a gal out.
dialogue.rejected: Well, I'll find someone else to do it for me.
dialogue.advice: Plenty of fridges in towns.  Gotta be some left overs in some of them houses.
dialogue.success: Thanks!  I'll be sure to put in a good word for you around the center.
